title: Effect of Higher Pressure on Gas Equilibrium

content.description: <math alttext="N 2, gas, plus, 3 H 2, gas, is in equilibrium with, 2 N H 3, gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><msub><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>⇄</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>2</mn><msub><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>NH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: A <math alttext="2.0 liter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>L</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> reaction vessel contains an equilibrium mixture of the system represented above. The partial pressures of the components of the mixture at equilibrium are listed in the table below.<math alttext="P N 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="P H 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="P N H 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>NH</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="0.30 atmosphere" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.30</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>atm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="0.50 atmosphere" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.50</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>atm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="0.20 atmosphere" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.20</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>atm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> Which of the following is the best estimate of the total pressure of the system when the volume of the container is reduced to <math alttext="1.0 liter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>L</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> at a constant temperature?

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
